And behold, your personal Task Managing Assistant, **Mei**!
This application is optimized for usage via a **Command Line Interface** (CLI) while still having a Graphical User Interface (GUI).
You may add ToDo tasks by typing the following command:
You may expect an output like this:
![Expected output for adding a ToDo task](AddToDoOutput.png)
You may add Deadline and Event tasks by typing the following command:
> The format of the date/time has to be in day/month/year HoursMinutes in the 24-hour time format.
> However, you may swap out the `/` for `-`.
> The day and year may be swapped too.
You may expect an output like this:
![Expected output for adding a Deadline task](AddDeadlineOutput.png)
![Expected output for adding an Event task](AddEventOutput.png)
After adding a few tasks, you may want to see what you have added so far.
Simply type `list`, and you can see:
> What's a task management assistant if she can't even `mark`/ `unmark` your tasks for you? - Me
To mark/ unmark the completion of your tasks, simply type:
> Use the `list` command to see the number of your tasks on the list!
You may expect an output like this:
Finding specific tasks from your long list is ~~tough sometimes~~ **MADE EASY**!
You may find any tasks by typing the following command:
> The keyword to find a task must be part of the task description!
You may expect an output like this:
**Undo** previous commands within the ***same*** user session by typing `undo`!
> You may be wondering, where do the tasks get saved to in your devices?
> Well *fear not*! Here's the `main` method ðŸ˜‰
> You may find all of your saved task data from the given relative path!
* Represents the main class for the chatbot known as Mei.
* Consists of all the managers that are passed into other managers to establish communication between the managers.
* The chatbot application shall be run from the main method.
* Initializes the chatbot known as Mei.
* Sets up the connections between managers.
* Initializes the file storage with the given file path to save task data.
* Also starts up by greeting the user first.
* @param filePath The file path to save task data.
// Initialize response manager to process user input and generate responses.
* Sends the responses from Mei to the MainWindow after processing the user input via the managers.
* The user input is redirected by the input manager to other managers,
* which then sets the field that is used to display to the user as a response.
* @param userInput The user input to redirect and get a response out of.
* Represents the Mei exception that is thrown when a timed task given

* echoErrorResponse should be called when this exception is caught.
* This is classified as a task-related exception.

"And feel free to swap the placements of the day and year.",

* Represents the parent class for all exceptions specific to Mei.
* This class is a throwable and should be called using echoErrorResponse when caught.
* This class also holds an array of error response strings.
* Prompts the error responses to the user when a Mei exception is thrown.
* This method should be called whenever a Mei exception is caught by the try-catch clause.
* The error response array is defined at the construction of any Mei exceptions.
* Represents the Mei exception that is thrown when there is a date/time conversion error while processing a task.
* echoErrorResponse should be called when this exception is caught.
* This is classified as a process task-related exception.
private static final String[] ERROR_RESPONSES = new String[] {
"Uh oh, there seems to be an invalid date/time in one of your tasks.",
"I cannot process this task, so feel free to re-add it!"
* Represents the Mei exception that is thrown when the user tries to access a task index that is invalid.
* The task index is invalid if it falls outside the bounds (i.e. not an index held by any existing task.).
* echoErrorResponse should be called when this exception is caught.
* This is classified as a task-related exception.
private static final String[] ERROR_RESPONSES = new String[] {
"Hmm..? This task number doesn't seem to be"
+ " on the list...", "Can you repeat with a valid one? :3"
* Represents the Mei exception that is thrown when the user tries to add a new task with a type that is invalid.
* The task type is invalid if it does not exist in the TASK_TYPES list defined within the Task Manager class.
* echoErrorResponse should be called when this exception is caught.
* This is classified as a task-related exception.
private static final String[] ERROR_RESPONSES = new String[] {
"Oops! I think you may have entered an unknown task type!"
+ "Please try again!", "The accepted tasks are todo, deadline, and event :))"
* Represents the Mei exception that is thrown when the user gives an input undefined to Mei.

"Come again? I don't quite get what you are saying."
